item.title: I-90 East - Exit 23
item.description: I-90 east approaching Exit 23 - Pompeys Pillar. Pompeys Pillar is a sandstone outcrop, that is special because it has a signature of William Clark, from the Lewis and Clark expedition engraved in it. William Clark named Pompeys Pillar after Sacagawea’s infant son Jean Baptiste, whom Clark had nicknamed Pompey.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 113
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 113 - Exit 113. This is the only instance of an interchange in Idaho with simply the name of its exit. The advanced signage at this interchange is Shelley, and same as the southbound exit name. This sign has been in place since BL-15 and US-26 was routed to the newer Exit 116 interchange.

It is part of the Oregon State Highway system as the Medical Springs Highway but is not signed with a number.

item.description: I-84 East (Exit 302) off ramp at OR-86. Turn right for OR-86 west to (Oregon Trail) Interpretive Center, Richland, OR, and Hells Canyon. Turn left for Baker City access.

item.title: End OR-7 East Approaching I-84 West
item.description: End OR-7 East approaching I-84 West to Richland (via OR-86), Hells Canyon (via OR-86) and La Grande.

item.title: End OR-7 East at I-84 East
item.description: End OR-7 East at I-84 East. Turn right for I-84 east to Ontario; straight for I-84 west to La Grande and (Oregon Trail) Interpretive Center.

item.title: US-20 East - Malheur County/Mountain Time Zone
item.description: Entering Malheur County and Mountain Time Zone on US-20 East. The northern portion of Malheur County is the only area in Oregon that follows Mountain Time. From my travels in Oregon, this is the only blue time zone sign in the state. The rest are the standard green color.

item.title: US-20 East/US-395 North at OR-78
item.description: US-20 East/US-395 north at OR-78 in Burns.

item.title: US-20 East/US-395 North Approaching OR-78
item.description: US-20 East/US-395 North approaching OR-78. Turn left for US-20 East/US-395 North to John Day (via US-395) and Value (via US-20). Continue straight for OR-78 East to Crane and Winnemucca (Nevada).

item.title: US-20 East/US-395 North - Hines Logging Road
item.description: US-20 East/US-395 North -at CR-127 Jct (Hines Logging Road). Use CR-127 for FR-47, Yellowjacket Lake, and Delintment Lake in the Malheur National Forest.

item.description: End OR-242 East at US-20/OR-126. Use US-20/OR-126 East for Sisters, Bend, and Redmond.

item.description: OR-242 East at Hood St. (To US-20/OR-126). Turn left to connect with US-20/OR-126 for Eugene and Sisters. Traffic can also continue east on current street for US-20/OR-126 East.

item.title: OR-242 East Approaching US-20/OR-126
item.description: OR-242 East approaching US-20/OR-126 in Sisters.

item.title: OR-126 East at OR-242
item.description: OR-126 East at OR-242. OR-126 east turns north towards Santiam Pass and OR-242 crosses the Cascades at McKenzie Pass. McKenzie Highway follows OR-242 over the pass and rejoins OR-126 in Sisters.

item.title: OR-126 East Approaching OR-528 Exit
item.description: OR-126 East approaching - OR-528 South/Springfield City Center.

The destination Oregon Coast is common along signs in Oregon, along with Ocean Beaches to denote costal locations.

Continue straight for US-20/OR-34 West/OR-99W South to Philomath, Ocean Beaches, and Eugene. Notice the OR-99W North shield is incorrectly displayed as a US highway shield.

item.description: US-26 east at US-93 in downtown Shoshone. US-26 joins US-93 northbound to Arco.

item.description: ID-46 North approaching US-26 in Gooding.

item.description: BL-84 west approaching I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 in Mountain Home. This is the western end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.description: ID-51 north at Old US-30. Use Old US-30 for I-84 eastbound access. Continue north on ID-51 for I-84, BL-84, Boise, Glenns Ferry, and Twin Falls. This intersection used to route Twin Falls traffic along Old US-30, but has recently been changed to route traffic along the business loop.

item.description: UT-30 west approaching UT-42. Use UT-42 for Boise (Idaho). Continue west (turn left) on UT-30 for Park Valley, Grouse Creek, and Elko (Nevada). Boise is an interesting destination city to put on this sign since Boise is on the entire other side of the state from where UT-42 crosses into Idaho. Malta, or even Burley would be more appropriate.

item.description: UT-30 west at Black Pine Road jct. to Black Pine, Sublett, and Juniper. All three of those destinations are tiny communities within Idaho.

item.title: Mills Ave. West at NM-518
item.description: Mills Ave. west at NM-518. Use NM-518 north for Storrie Lake (State Park), Mora, and Taos. From the documentation I can find, it appears that Mills Ave. was formerly signed as NM-329. There were no NM-329 shields along Mills Ave. in 2013, when this picture was taken. This is also the southern end of NM-518, which used to extend south through Las Vegas to BL-25.

item.description: US-50 east in Scipio. To continue on US-50 traffic turns right on State St. Turn right for I-70, Salina, and Richfield. US-50 provides shorter access for southbound I-15 traffic to I-70, then continuing on I-15 to I-70 jct.

item.description: US-50 east at I-15 north to Salt Lake City. US-50 joins I-15 south to Holden.

item.title: US-50 East at I-15 North
item.description: US-50 east at I-15 north. Notice the word UTAH in the I-15 shield. On this trip I noticed the word UTAH in signs in the Provo area, in addition to this shield. Before this I have never seen a Utah interstate shield containing the state name.

item.description: I-15 south approaching Exit 188 - US-50 East/Scipio. US-50 joins I-15 south from Scipio to Holden.

item.title: NV-431 East at US-395
item.description: NV-431 east at US-395. This is the southern end of the current US-395 freeway. The section between NV-431 and Washoe Lake is expected to be completed in late 2012. For US-395 north to Reno continue straight. In late 2012, the right lanes will be for US-395 south to Carson City and South Lake Tahoe.

item.description: CA-267 south at Martis Creek Lake Jct. Turn left for Martis Creek Lake Recreation Area, and Waddle Ranch Access. The ski slopes of Northstar-At-Tahoe are visible on the upper right side of the picture.

item.description: I-80 east Exit 188B offramp at CA-89/CA-267 junction. Turn left for CA-89 north to Sierraville. Turn right for CA-267 south to Lake Tahoe.

item.description: I-80 west at Exit 106 - CA-65/Lincoln/Marysville. Continue west on I-80 for Sacramento.

item.description: End OR-78 east at US-95. Turn right for US-95 south to McDermitt and Winnemucca (Nevada). Merge left for US-95 north to Jordan Valley and Boise (Idaho).

item.description: End OR-78 east at US-95. Continue straight for US-95 south; merge left for US-95 north.

item.title: End Eastside Steens Mountain Road at OR-78
item.description: End Eastside Steens Mountain Road at OR-78. Turn right on OR-78 for Burns Junction; turn left on OR-78 for Crane. The eastside Steens Mountain road follows the east side of Steens Mountain south to Andrews, Fields, and eventually into Denio, Nevada.

item.description: US-395 North/OR-140 East at US-395/OR-140 split. Turn right for OR-140 east to Adel, Plush, and Winnemucca (Nevada). Continue north on US-395 for Burns and Bend. US-395 is part of the Oregon Outback Scenic Byway.

item.description: OR-140 east at US-395 junction. Turn right for US-395 south to Alturas (California). Turn left for US-395 North/OR-140 east to Burns. OR-140 east joins US-395 north through Lakeview.

item.description: OR-140 west at US-395. OR-140 west joins US-395 south into Lakeview. Use US-395 north for Burns and Bend. Use US-395 South/OR-140 West for Lakeview and Klamath Falls.

item.title: US-395 South OR-140
item.description: US-395 South at OR-140. Use OR-140 east for Adel, Plush, and Winnemucca (Nevada). OR-140 west joins US-395 into Lakeview.

item.description: US-395 south approaching OR-140 east to Adel and Winnemucca (Nevada).

item.title: Milemarker at OR-31/US-395 Junction
item.description: Milemarker 120E at OR-31/US-395 junction. These type of milemarkers with the letter suffix have started to appear around Oregon. The letter indicates the segment of highway that the mileage is for. In Oregon, mile markers are posted according to internal highway, not posted route number (except for intersate highways). In this case the milemarker is for Fremont Highway. A posted highway can be composed of have multiple segments of internal highways.

item.description: End OR-31 south at US-395. Use US-395 south for Lakeview and Reno (Nevada). Use US-395 north for Wagontire and Burns.

item.title: US-97 South at OR-370 (O'Neil Highway)
item.description: US-97 south at OR-370 to O’Neill and Lone Pine. OR-370 is not signed as such at this junction, but is part of the O’Neil Highway. This is part of the Oregon State Highway system that did not have a posted route number. In recent years the Oregon Department of Transportation has been assigning numbers to routes that have previously been unsigned.

item.description: US-97 South/US-26 East at US-97/US-26 split. Turn left for US-26 east to Prineville, Mitchell, and John Day.

item.description: US-97 south at US-26. Turn right for US-26 west to Portland. Turn left for US-26 east and US-97 south to Redmond, Prineville, and Bend. US-26 joins US-97 south through Madras.

item.description: US-97 south approaching US-26 in Madras.

item.title: US-97 South at OR-293
item.description: US-97 south at OR-293. Use OR-293 east to Antelope, John Day Fossil Beds, and Fossil.

item.title: US-97 South Approaching OR-293
item.description: US-97 south approaching OR-293 in Jefferson County.

item.title: US-97 South at US-197
item.description: US-97 south at US-197. Use US-97 south for Madras and Bend. The northbound destination sign for US-197 was knocked over and lying on the ground.

item.title: US-97 South at US-197
item.description: US-97 south at US-197 junction. Taken at Shaniko Junction.

item.title: US-97 South at OR-218
item.description: US-97 south at OR-218 to Antelope and Fossil. Continue south on US-97 for Maupin, Madras, and Bend.

item.title: US-97 South Approaching OR-218
item.description: US-97 south approaching OR-218 in Shaniko.

item.title: US-97 South at OR-216
item.description: US-97 south at OR-216. Use OR-216 west for Sherars Bridge, Tygh Valley, and Deschutes River Recreation Area.

item.title: US-97 South Approaching OR-216
item.description: US-97 south approaching OR-216 west - Sherars Bridge Highway.

item.title: US-97 South at OR-206 Interchange
item.description: US-97 South at OR-206 Interchange to Wasco and Condon.

item.title: US-97 South Approaching OR-206 IC
item.description: US-97 south approaching OR-206 interchange to Wasco and Condon.

item.title: US-97 North at WA-14
item.description: US-97 north at WA-14 north. US-97 north joins WA-14 west for about two miles. Turn right on WA-14 east for Kennewick. Turn left on WA-14 west for Vancouver. Also turn left for US-97 north to Yakima and Goldendale.

item.title: Rowena Access Road at I-84
item.description: Rowena Access Road at I-84 (Exit 76) onramp. Turn right for I-84 east to The Dalles. Turn left for I-84 west to Hood River, and to continue under freeway towards Mayer State Park.

item.title: W 2nd St. at US-30 and I-84
item.description: W 2nd St. in The Dalles at US-30 and I-84 east junction. Turn right for I-84 east, to Pendleton, and US-30 west. Continue ahead on 2nd St. for US-30 east. Turn left for the Port Area along the Columbia River.

item.title: W 2nd St. Approaching US-30
item.description: W 2nd St. approaching US-30 in The Dalles.

item.title: US-30 West - Downtown The Dalles
item.description: E 2nd St. west in downtown The Dalles. Use right lanes to continue west on US-30 toward Portland.

item.title: US-30 West at SE Frontage Road
item.description: US-30 west at SE Frontage Road.

item.title: US-197 South/US-30 West at Split
item.description: US-197 South/US-30 West at US-197/US-30 split. Turn right for US-30 west to The Dalles. Turn left for US-197 south to Dufur and Bend.

item.title: US-97 North at I-84/US-30 (Exit 104)
item.description: US-97 north at I-84/US-30 (Exit 104) junction. Turn right on I-84/US-30 east for Rufus and Pendleton. Continue over freeway for I-84/US-30 west to The Dalles. The Columbia River, and bridge over the Columbia River into Washington is in the background of the photograph.

item.title: US-97 North at I-84 Frontage Road
item.description: I-84 north at I-84 Frontage Road, and approaching I-84/US-30 junction. Turn left on the Frontage Road for Deschutes State Park. Continue north on US-97 for I-84 junction, and Yakima (Washington). The Columbia River and Washington state are in the background of the photograph.

item.title: OR-206 West at US-97
item.description: OR-206 west at US-97 onramp. Turn right for US-97 north to Biggs Junction and The Dalles. Continue over the highway for US-97 southbound ramp to Bend.

item.title: OR-206 West In Wasco
item.description: OR-206 west on Clark St. at Armsworthy St. in Wasco. Turn left on Armsworthy St. to continue on OR-206 for Fulton Canyon, (Wasco) City Park and US-97. Turn right for the Wasco Airport.

item.title: OR-206 West at Clark St. - Wasco
item.description: OR-206 west at Clark St. in Wasco. Turn left on Clark St. south to US-97 South towards Moro and Grass Valley. Turn right on Clark St. for US-97 north, OR-206 west to Biggs Jct. and The Dalles.

item.title: OR-206 East at OR-19
item.description: OR-206 east at OR-19 in Condon. Continue ahead for OR-19 north to Arlington. Turn right for OR-206 East/OR-19 South for Fossil, Heppner, and John Day. Turn left on Main St. for the Medical Center.

item.title: OR-206 West at OR-19
item.description: OR-206 west at OR-19 in Condon. OR-206 joins OR-19 through Condon. Turn left for OR-19 south to Fossil and John Day. Turn right for OR-19 north/OR-206 west to Arlington and Wasco.

item.title: OR-206 West/OR-207 West at Split
item.description: OR-206 West/OR-207 West at OR-206/OR-207 split. Turn right for OR-206 west to Condon. Turn left for OR-207 west to Hardman and Spray.

item.title: OR-74 North at OR-206/OR-207
item.description: OR-74 north at OR-206 and OR-207 in Heppner. Turn right to continue north on OR-74 North and OR-207 North to Lexington, Ione, and Arlington. Turn left on Main St. for OR-207 south and OR-206 west to Condon and Spray.

item.title: US-395 South at OR-74
item.description: US-395 south at OR-74. Turn right for OR-74 west to Heppner and Condon. Merge left for US-395 south to Ukiah and John Day.

item.title: US-395 Jct. at Battle Mountain State Park
item.description: US-395 junction at Battle Mountain State Park entrance road. Turn right for US-395 south to Ukiah; left for US-395 north to Pilot Rock.

item.title: End OR-244 West at US-395
item.description: End OR-244 west at US-395. Turn right for US-395 north to Pendleton. Turn left for US-395 south to Long Creek and John Day.

item.title: End OR-244 West at US-395
item.description: End OR-244 west at US-395 junction.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 38
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 38 - BL-84/Garrity Blvd/Idaho Center Blvd. Use I-84 east for Meridian and Boies. This is the eastern end of the Nampa/Caldwell business loop. This interchange was recently rebuilt as part of the widening of I-84 between Nampa and Boise.

item.title: ID-55 South at I-84/US-30
item.description: ID-55 south at I-84/US-30 junction (Exit 33). Turn right for I-84/US-30 East/ID-55 south to Boise. Turn left for I-84/US-30 west to Caldwell and Ontario (Oregon). Continue ahead for Midland Blvd. ID-55 joins I-84 east to Meridian.

item.title: US-95 Alt. North at US-50 Alt./BL-80
item.description: US-95 ALT at US-50 ALT to Fallon and BL-80 to Reno and Elko. Turn right to continue on US-95 Alt.

item.title: Alt. US-95 North at US-50/Alt. US-50
item.description: Alt. US-95 North at US-50/Alt. US-50 in Silver Springs. This is the western end of Alt. US-50. Alt. US-50 follows Alt. US-95 north to Fernley, thence east to outside of Fallon rejoining with US-50.

item.title: Alt. US-95 North Approaching US-50/Alt. US-50
item.description: Alt. US-95 North Approaching US-50/Alt. US-50. Turn left on US-50 west for Carson City and Virginia City National Historic Landmark; right on US-50 east for Fallon. Continue ahead on Alt. US-50 East/Alt. US-95 North for Fallon.

item.title: Alt. US-95 North Approaching US-50
item.description: Alt. US-95 North approaching US-50 and Alt. US-50 in Silver Springs.

item.title: Alt. US-95 North at NV-339
item.description: Alt. US-95 North at NV-339 in Yerrington. Turn left for NV-339 south; turn right to continue north on Alt. US-95.

item.title: Alt. US-95 North Approaching NV-339
item.description: Alt. US-95 North approaching NV-339 in Yerrington. Use NV-339 south for Wellington; use Alt. US-95 north for Fernley and Reno.

item.title: Alt. US-95 North Approaching NV-339
item.description: Alt. US-95 North approaching NV-339.

item.title: NV-208 North Approaching Alt. US-95
item.description: NV-208 North approaching Alt. US-95 in Yerrington. Use Alt. US-95 South (straight ahead) for Hawthorne and Las Vegas. Use Alt. US-95 North (left) for Fernley.

item.title: NV-208 North Approaching Alt. US-95
item.description: NV-208 north approaching Alt. US-95 north in Yerrington. Below the Alt. US-95 shield is a Nevada post mile marker. Nevada state and US highways do not have traditional mile markers, but instead have these post mile markers. The mileage on these markers reset at each county line. The top line is the route type, in this case SR (State Route). The next line is the two character county abbreviation - LY for Lyon County.

item.title: End NV-208 North
item.description: End NV-208 north at Alt. US-95 junction in Yerrington.

item.title: NV-208 North at NV-824
item.description: NV-208 north at NV-824 in Smith Valley. Turn right to continue on NV-208 towards Yerrington and Las Vegas.

item.title: NV-338 North at NV-829 (To NV-208)
item.description: NV-338 North at NV-829 (To NV-208). This intersection is not well marked. NV-829 is marked To NV-208, when it should be marked To NV-208 South. Northbound NV-208 traffic should continue north on NV-338.

item.title: NV-338 North Approaching NV-829
item.description: NV-339 north approaching NV-829. Use NV-829 north for Wellington and Gardnerville. Use NV-338 north for Yerrington and Las Vegas.

item.title: US-395 South at CA-182
item.description: US-395 south at CA-182 in Bridgeport. When this picture was taken, US-395 was closed in the evenings north of Bridgeport, so northbound US-395 traffic had to use CA-182 to reach Reno and Carson City, hence the orange directional signs.

item.title: US-395 South Approaching CA-182
item.description: US-395 south approaching CA-182 north to Yerrington (Nevada).

item.title: US-395 South Approaching CA-182
item.description: US-395 South approaching CA-182 in Bridgeport.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-182
item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-182 north to Yerrington (Nevada). Turn left to continue north on US-395.

item.title: US-395 South Approaching CA-270
item.description: US-395 South Approaching CA-270 east to Bodie.

item.title: US-395 North at CA-167
item.description: US-395 north at CA-167 east to Hawthorne (Nevada). Turn left for Lundy Lake.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-167
item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-167 east to Hawthorne (Nevada).

item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-120 east to Tioga Pass and Yosemite. Tioga Pass was opened the day after this picture was taken.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-158
item.description: US-395 North Approaching CA-158 - June Lake Loop (north end).

item.title: US-395 North At CA-120 East
item.description: US-395 north at CA-120 east. CA-120 west joins US-395 north to Lee Vining.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-120 East
item.description: US-395 North Approaching CA-120 East to Benton. CA-120 west joins US-395 north to Lee Vining.

item.title: US-395 North at US-6
item.description: US-395 north at US-6 in Bishop. Use US-6 east for Tonopah (Nevada). This is the western terminus of US-6. The eastern end of US-6 is Provincetown, MA.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching US-6
item.description: US-395 north approaching US-6 in Bishop. Use US-6 east for US-95. This is the western terminus of US-6.

item.title: US-395 North at CA-168
item.description: US-395 north at CA-168 east. CA-168 west joins US-395 north to Bishop.

item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-168 east. Use CA-168 east for US-95 (in Nevada). CA-168 heads east from here over the White Mountains into Nevada.

item.description: US-395 North at CA-136 East on the south side of Lone Pine. CA-136 heads east across the north and east edges of dry Owens Lake to CA-190 junction.

item.title: US-395 North at CA-136 (To CA-190)
item.description: US-395 north at CA-136 north to CA-190. Use CA-136 east for Death Valley. The logo at the bottom of the sign, with the number 20 written on it, is for the Eastern Sierra Scenic Byway. Site number 20 refers to the Highest to Lowest and Desert’s Edge interpretive site.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-136
item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-136 east to Death Valley.

item.title: US-395 North at CA-190 East
item.description: US-395 north at CA-190 east. Use CA-190 east for Death Valley and Panamint Springs.

item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-190 east to Death Valley.

item.title: US-395 North Approaching CA-190
item.description: US-395 north approaching CA-190 east to Death Valley.

item.description: End CA-14 north at US-395. CA-14 starts in Los Angeles, and runs 116 miles to US-395 in Kern County.

item.title: CA-14 North/CA-178 East at CA-178 East
item.description: CA-14 North/CA-178 East at CA-178 East junction. Turn right for CA-178 east to Inyokern, China Lake, and Ridgecrest. CA-178 leaves US-395 here.

item.title: CA-14 North/CA-178 East Approaching CA-178 East
item.description: CA-14 North/CA-178 East approaching CA-178 east. Use CA-178 east for Inyokern, Ridgecrest, and US-395 south. Northbound US-395 traffic continue north on CA-14.

item.title: CA-14 North Approaching CA-178 West
item.description: CA-14 North approaching CA-178 West to Isabella. CA-178 east joins CA-14 north briefly to the Inyokern area.

item.title: CA-14 North at CA-58 West Onramp
item.description: CA-14 North at CA-58 West onramp to Bakersfield.

item.description: CA-14 north at CA-58 (Exit 167) junction. Turn right for CA-58 East to Barstow; continue over overpass and then left for CA-58 west to Bakersfield.

item.description: CA-14 North/Bus. CA-58 West split. Turn right for CA-14 north to Bishop. Continue ahead for CA-58 (via Business CA-58) west to Bakersfield.

item.description: CA-14 North/Business CA-58 North split in Mojave. Turn right for CA-14 north to Bishop and Reno (Nevada). Continue ahead for CA-58 (via Business CA-58) to Bakersfield.

item.description: CA-14 north at Business CA-58 in Mojave. Turn right on Business CA-58 for Barstow; continue north for Bishop and Bakersfield. Business CA-58 joins CA-14 north for a few blocks through Mojave. Up until 2004, CA-58 traffic went through Mojave on the current route of Business CA-58.

item.description: CA-138 East at CA-14 North onramp to Mojave.

item.title: CA-138 East Approaching CA-14
item.description: CA-138 east approaching CA-14. CA-138 east joins CA-14 south to Palmdale.

item.description: I-5 north at Exit 170 - CA-126 West/Ventura/Newhall Ranch Road. I-5 continues north to Sacramento. This sign is strange because the words Ventura and Newhall Ranch Road are separated by an "&" instead of a new line.

item.description: I-5 north approaching Exit 162 - CA-14 North/Palmdale/Lancaster. I-5 continues north towards Sacramento. When this picture was taken CA-14 was closed by an accident at the Red Rover interchange. I had to change my travel plans and follow I-5 up the Grapevine and cut over to CA-14 on CA-138.

item.title: I-5 North - Exit 161A
item.description: I-5 north at Exit1 61A - I-5/CA-14/Truck Route. All I-5 northbound and CA-14 northbound trucks must exit here. This provides a separate lane for trucks through the I-210 on ramps, and CA-14 interchange. All I-5 and CA-14 auto traffic continue north along main freeway.

item.description: I-5 north at Exit 159B - Roxford St. Approaching Exit 161B - I-210 East/Pasadena. I-5 continues north towards Sacramento.

item.description: I-405 north at Exit 70 - Devonshire St. Approaching Exit 71A - CA-118. I-405 continues north towards Sacramento.

item.description: US-101 south approaching Exit 19B - Haskell Ave and Exit 19A - I-405/Sacramento/Santa Monica. Continue south on US-101 for (Downtown) Los Angeles.

item.description: Las Virgenes Road North at US-101. Use US-101 south for Los Angeles; US-101 north for Ventura.

item.description: CA-14 south at Bus. CA-58 in Mojave. Turn right for Bus. CA-58 west towards Bakersfield. Turn left to continue south on CA-14 and Bus. CA-58 east towards Los Angeles.

item.description: CA-14 South approaching Bus. CA-58. To continue south on CA-14 towards Los Angeles, turn left at intersection.

item.description: CA-14 South/CA-178 West at CA-14/CA-178 split. Turn right for CA-178 west to Weldon and Lake Isabella.

item.description: CA-14 South/CA-178 West approaching CA-178 West. Use CA-178 west for Lake Isabella.

item.description: CA-178 west approaching CA-14. Turn right on CA-14 north for Bishop; left on CA-14 South/CA-178 West for Los Angeles. CA-178 west joins CA-14 south for a few miles.

item.description: CA-178 west at Brown Road, to US-395 north towards Bishop. Continue west on CA-178 for CA-14 junction.

item.title: SW Baker St. North at OR-99W
item.description: SW Baker St. North at OR-99W. SW Baker St. is the ramp that connects OR-18 eastbound to OR-99W northbound and turns into a surface street. It is signed as OR-99W, but does not actually reach OR-99W until this light at Old Sheridan Road. Turn right for OR-99W South to Amity and Corvallis. Continue ahead for Linfield College and City Center (McMinnville).

item.description: I-25 South/US-20 East/US-26 East/US-87 South at Bryan Stock Trail. US-20/US-26/US-87 leave I-25 south here. Turn left to return north on I-25 towards Midwest and Shoshoni.

item.description: I-25 South/US-20 East/US-26 East/US-87 South at Bryan Stock Trail. US-20/US-26/US-87 leave I-25 south here. Turn right for US-20/US-26 west and US-87 south. Continue ahead for I-25 south for Cheyenne.

item.description: I-25 south at Exit 188A - BL-25/BL-87/Center St. Approaching Exit 187 - McKinley St. Exit 187 is signed as I-25 and US-87 south, but this is an error. Neither highway exit at McKinley St.

item.description: Begin WY-387 north at I-25/US-87. Use I-25 South/US-87 South for Casper. I-25 North/US-87 North is signed for Midwest, where actually WY-387 north heads towards Midwest. The actual destination for I-25/US-87 North would be for Kaycee or Buffalo.

item.description: I-25 south at WY-387. Use WY-387 North for Midwest and Edgerton. Continue ahead to return to I-25 south. Notice the closed highway gate for severe weather.

item.description: WY-387 south at WY-258 in Midwest. Turn right to continue west on WY-387, and for I-25 traffic. It is probably shorter for I-25 south traffic to use WY-259 south, even though it is signed otherwise.

item.description: WY-387 South at WY-192. Use WY-192 north for Linch.

item.description: WY-116 south approaching US-16 in Upton, Wyoming.

item.description: I-90/US-14 West at Exit 189 - BL-90/US-14 West/Sundance. US-14 leaves I-90 here and heads northwest to the Devils Tower National Monument. This is the eastern end of the Sundance business loop.

item.description: I-90 west offramp (Exit 199) at WY-111. Use WY-111 north for Alladin, Heulett, and Devils Tower (National Monument).

item.description: End WY-111 north at WY-24. Use WY-24 west for Heulett and Devils Tower (National Monument). Use WY-24 east for Belle Fourche (South Dakota).

item.description: US-85 South at SD-34. Continue south on US-85 for I-90 (at Spearfish).

item.description: US-85 North at SD-34. Continue north on US-85 for US-212 Junction.

item.description: I-90/US-14 West onramp (Exit 10) at west end of Spearfish business loop. Turn left for I-90/US-14 west; straight for US-85 North. The Exit 10 interchange is under construction when this photo was taken.

item.description: US-85 North at I-90/US-14 West (Exit 10). Turn left for US-14 and I-90 west. Interchange is currently under construction, and most of the traffic signs are temporary.

item.description: End BL-90 west at I-90/US-14 West/US-85 South Jct. Turn right for I-90/US-14 East/US-85 South.

item.description: I-90 east onramp at Exit 2, in rural Lawrence County, South Dakota.

item.description: I-90 onramp at Exit 549. Turn right for I-90 east; continue ahead under the underpass for I-90 west.
